text: In order to do that there would need to be a way for Pkg to know which packages are not available to download so those could be filtered out when doing the "resolve step".

elements.text: In order to do that there would need to be a way for Pkg to know which packages are not available to download so those could be filtered out when doing the "resolve step".

text: That's true. Now, the package server returns 404 and empty response for version that is not present. But I guess some way to obtain present of multiple versions at once would be needed to make it reasonably fast.

elements.text: That's true. Now, the package server returns 404 and empty response for version that is not present. But I guess some way to obtain present of multiple versions at once would be needed to make it reasonably fast.

text: The full list of all packages available would be needed up front

elements.text: The full list of all packages available would be needed up front

text: So, is this reasonable request and should I fill it as issue?

elements.text: So, is this reasonable request and should I fill it as issue?

text: I'm not sure it is that reasonable, I think the assumption has to be that the package server has the packages needed. Otherwise it is faulty.

elements.text: I'm not sure it is that reasonable, I think the assumption has to be that the package server has the packages needed. Otherwise it is faulty.

text: But the package server should not serve a registry where it doesn't have the versions

elements.text: But the package server should not serve a registry where it doesn't have the versions

text: Problem is I guess when you have a git registry

elements.text: Problem is I guess when you have a git registry

text: But then you are probably ok with fallback git downloading?

elements.text: But then you are probably ok with fallback git downloading?

text: I think when you have git registry it's reasonable to expect git being accessible.

elements.text: I think when you have git registry it's reasonable to expect git being accessible.

text: So, I created an issue, so it does not disappear <https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/issues/2320>

elements.text: So, I created an issue, so it does not disappear

text: I am curious how you ran into this then? Did you have a git registry?

elements.text: I am curious how you ran into this then? Did you have a git registry?

text: No, I have registry from package server, because I can't reach git behind corporate firewall.
